intro: Dryomenis kwarenkoensis, commonly known as the Kwarenko's dryoma, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to dry environments. The plant typically grows in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, showcasing a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine layer of wax, helping to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human encroachment.
